FILE: cm002365v11.0.txt
DYAD: USA-RUSSIA/USSR
RIVALRY: RIV75
DISPUTE(S): MID4241 
RIVALRY: RIV76
DISPUTE(S): MID197 MID2606 MID2366
RIVALRY: RIV77
DISPUTE(S): MID252 MID26 MID1286 MID50 MID208 MID200 MID607 MID125 MID2215 MID173 MID608 MID2216 MID246 MID253 MID1363 MID27 MID2217 MID2219 MID3361 MID1353 MID61 MID2899 MID2218 MID2220 MID2909 MID611 MID2901 MID2910 MID2921 MID2934 MID2931 MID2930 MID345 MID2928 MID2941 MID3241 MID2221 MID2949 MID353 MID2222 MID2223 MID2224 MID2225 MID2226 MID2227 MID2228 MID2229 MID2982 MID2231 MID2230 MID2232 MID3637 MID2233 MID4174 MID4213 MID4220 MID419 

RIVNOTES: 

PS: 19009999-19170103 .5 19170104-19230701 0.00 19230702-19410930 0.25 19411001-19470614 0.5 19470615-19891108 0.00 19891109-19920201 -9 19920202-20209999 .25

PS-UPDATE2020:
 
PS-NOTES: US aid in Greek civil war starts in June 1947 (19470615) and we consider this the beginning of the Cold War between the USA and USSR 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20220208
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20220208

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

WWI MIDs: MID197 MID2606 MID2366

MID197 

TERRMID: MID197 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID197 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID197 coded not territory because although the US invaded Russian cities and occupied some territory, they were attempting to influence the outcome of the civil war and were not advancing a territorial claim. No territorial dispute between these countries. 

TERRLINK: MID197 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID197 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID197 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID197 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID197 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID197 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID197 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID197 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID197 , MID2606, and MID2366 all occurred in connection with the US interventions into the Russian Revolution. The rivalry between the US and the USSR began with US intervention in the Russian Revolution. The US sent troops into several Russian cities on several occasions, sparking clashes with Russian troops and several MIDs between 1918 and 1920. The Allied powers were attempting to help the anti-Bolshevik forces in Russia prevent the Bolsheviks from taking power. Coded civil war MID because the Russian revolution and its associated civil conflict caused the US to intervene militarily in order to influence the outcome of the civil war.

CIVWARLINK: MID197 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID197 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID197 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID197 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID197 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID197 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2606 

TERRMID: MID2606 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2606 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2606 coded not territory because although the US invaded Russian cities and occupied some territory, they were attempting to influence the outcome of the civil war and were not advancing a territorial claim. No territorial dispute between these countries. 

TERRLINK: MID2606 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2606 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2606 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2606 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2606 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2606 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2606 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2606 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2606 , MID197, and MID2366 all occurred in connection with the US interventions into the Russian Revolution. The rivalry between the US and the USSR began with US intervention in the Russian Revolution. The US sent troops into several Russian cities on several occasions, sparking clashes with Russian troops and several MIDs between 1918 and 1920. The Allied powers were attempting to help the anti-Bolshevik forces in Russia prevent the Bolsheviks from taking power. Coded civil war MID because the Russian revolution caused the US to intervene militarily in order to influence the outcome of the civil war.

CIVWARLINK: MID2606 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2606 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2606 this is a multilateral MID coded as a civil war MID in multiple dyads. 

COUPMID: MID2606 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2606 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2606 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2606 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2366 

TERRMID: MID2366 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2366 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2366 coded not territory because although the US invaded Russian cities and occupied some territory, they were attempting to influence the outcome of the civil war and were not advancing a territorial claim. No territorial dispute between these countries. 

TERRLINK: MID2366 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2366 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2366 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2366 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2366 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2366 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2366 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2366 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2366 , MID197, and MID2606 all occurred in connection with the US interventions into the Russian Revolution. The rivalry between the US and the USSR began with US intervention in the Russian Revolution. The US sent troops into several Russian cities on several occasions, sparking clashes with Russian troops and several MIDs between 1918 and 1920. The Allied powers were attempting to help the anti-Bolshevik forces in Russia prevent the Bolsheviks from taking power. Coded civil war MID because the Russian revolution caused the US to intervene militarily in order to influence the outcome of the civil war.

MID252 

TERRMID: MID252 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID252 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID252 from cm365640v11.0 narrative, Russia threatened Turkey and warned them not to launch an attack into Syria after Russia accused Turkey of amassing troops on the Syrian border in preparation for an invasion. From cm002365v11.0, the US sent an aircraft carrier to Turkish waters to deter Russia from interfering in Turkey. Coded not territorial because there was no territorial dispute between the US and Russia, nor between either of these countries and Russia.

TERRLINK: MID252 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID252 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID252 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID252 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID252 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID252 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID252 3 -- not civil war
CIVWARMID-CER: MID252 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID252 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID252 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID252 from cm365640v11.0 narrative, Russia accused and threatened Turkey of preparing an invasion into Syria to attack Armenians in Syria. Soviet Russia had been funding an Armenian resistance in Syria with the intention of annexing eastern Anatolia into the USSR. The Armenians in Syria were therefore a secessionist group, as they wanted an autonomous region and received the guarantee of autonomy from Russia if Eastern Anatolia became part of the USSR. Coded civil war link because the threat issued by Russia (and the response by the US) is connected to a militarized secessionist group in Syria (outside this dyad) being supported by Russia. 

COUPMID: MID252 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID252 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID252 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID252 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID26 

TERRMID: MID26 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID26 from cm narrative, this MID is the Berlin blockade crisis. Russia blockaded West Berlin after the US' plans for economic recovery and independence for a West German state became known. The US responded to the blockade by airlifting supplies into West Berlin. The US and Russia had repeated exchanges of shows of force. Coded not territorial because the US and Russia were not disputing territory between them. 

TERRLINK: MID26 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID26 coded not third party link to territory because although this MID was about the territory that would become West Germany (Federal Republic of Germany), and West and East Germany would later have a territorial dispute, neither East nor West Germany was yet a state, so no territorial claim was present yet, and the US and Russia were therefore not linked to a territorial dispute in this MID. 

MARITMID: MID26 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID26 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID26 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID26 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID26 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID26 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID1286 

TERRMID: MID1286 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1286 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1286 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID pitting US and Yugoslavia against USSR, Bulgaria, Hungary, and Romania. The tensions that led to this MID began when Yugoslavia and the USSR began to drift apart in terms of the ruling Yugoslavia Communist Party's willingness to acquiesce to Stalin's directives. The US observed the rift and tried to create an anti-Soviet state in the region by providing economic, food, and military assistance to Yugoslavia, and even attempted to bring Yugoslavia into NATO. Soviet troop mobilizations and border clashes occurred between Yugoslavia and Soviet-bloc states Hungary, Bulgaria, and Romania. The US and USSR are also included in this MID since they were rivals providing military assistance and/or orders, and the tension was tied to their rivalry. The US considered USSR's and its allies' behavior threatening during this MID, and the USSR found the US's intervention threatening. Coded not territorial because the US and Russia did not dispute any territory between them in this MID. 

TERRLINK: MID1286 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1286 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1286 coded not third party link to territory because this was not a territorial MID between USSR and Yugoslavia. The USSR was attempting to replace the government of Yugoslavia with a more friendly communist government, but the USSR was not making a territorial claim on Yugoslavia. This was a political leadership dispute between Yugoslavia and the USSR that involved the US and several Soviet bloc states. 

MARITMID: MID1286 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1286 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1286 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1286 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1286 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1286 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1286 from cm narrative, Stalin attempted to create domestic unrest that would result in an overthrow of the communist government in Yugoslavia and the replacement by a more USSR-friendly communist government. However, the domestic unrest did not result in violence or a militarized rebel group during this MID. Coded not civil war because no militarized anti-government group was present. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1286 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1286 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1286 coded not civil war link because although Stalin was attempting to foment domestic unrest in Yugoslavia, no militarized rebel group formed in this MID, and there are therefore no third party links to civil war in this multilateral dispute. 

COUPMID: MID1286 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1286 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1286 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1286 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID50 

TERRMID: MID50 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID50 from cm narrative, this MID occurred from 1953 to 1956. The primary combatants in this conflict were the PRC and Taiwan. Here the USSR assisted the PRC in a four-day operation designed to show support for the PRC in hostilities toward Taiwan. The US lifted its blockade of Taiwan, allowing Taiwan to attack mainland China. China shelled an island in response. Fighting between PRC and ROC forces ensued at several locations. The US is involved in this MID due to China seizing US airmen and the US in response threatening China, and because of US resolutions to defend Taiwan which included threats to China to not invade Taiwan. The USSR is involved in this MID because of its support for China. Coded not territorial because the US and Russia did not have a territorial claim involving China or Taiwan. See TERRLINK. 

TERRLINK: MID50 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID50 from cm narrative, Taiwan and China (ROC and PRC) had an ongoing territorial dispute in this MID, leading to the clashes between them. (The disputed territory includes some islands.) The US and Russia supported Taiwan and China, respectively, and their support drew them into this MID. Coded third party link to territorial MID because the Taiwan-China territorial MID caused a MID between US and Russia here. 

MARITMID: MID50 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID50 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID50 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID50 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID50 coded civil war link because this is related to the China-Taiwan dispute, outside of this dyad, and that conflict has a civil war element. 

COUPMID: MID50 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID50 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID208 

TERRMID: MID208 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID208 occurred in March of 1953 and is a multilateral dispute with the US and the UK versus the USSR and Czechoslovakia. Czechoslovakia sentenced a US reporter to prison for espionage. The US imposed economic sanctions, and Czechoslovakia shot down a US military aircraft over US-occupied Germany. Russia is involved in this MID because of its support for Czechoslovakia in this dispute. Coded not territorial because the US and Russia did not have a territorial dispute here. 

TERRLINK: MID208 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID208 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral dispute with the US and the UK versus the USSR and Czechoslovakia. The US and USSR were third parties to territorial disputes, including East Germany vs West Germany (GDR vs FRG), but the US and USSR did not actually claim each other's sovereign territory. However, this MID is coded not third party link because although Czechoslovakia was a Soviet ally, this was not a MID about advancing a territorial claim. It was a diplomatic dispute. 

MARITMID: MID208 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID208 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID208 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID208 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID208 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID208 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES:



MID200 

TERRMID: MID200 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID200 from cm narrative, MID200 is the Sinai War between Israel and Egypt and a multilateral MID. Israel and Egypt were rivals and tensions between them had been escalating, including cross-border raids, opposing arms deals, and troop movements around the Sinai. The US is involved in this MID due to its support for Israel. Russia is involved in this MID due to its support of Egypt/opposition of Israel, and its support for Czechoslovakia, who made a large arms deal with Israel shortly before the invasion. In 1956, Israel invaded the Sinai Peninsula with the intention of reclaiming it for itself and its Western allies, namely France and Britain. Coded not territory because the US and USSR did not dispute territory here. See TERRLINK: Israel invaded Sinai with the intention of annexing the territory, although it abandoned this claim when its Western allies demanded it do so. 

TERRLINK: MID200 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID200 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID involving allies of Israel and Egypt. Coded territorial link because Israel and Egypt were involved in a territorial MID here, and the US and Russia were pulled in to the dispute due to their support of opposing sides of the dispute. 

MARITMID: MID200 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID200 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID200 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID200 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID200 from cm narrative, part of the building tensions between Egypt and Israel came from Egypt sponsoring a rebel group, Fedayeen, to conduct attacks on Israel. In response, Israel conducted cross-border raids in Egypt, which were some of the events that this MID comprises. Coded civil war link because Egypt sponsored a militarized rebel group against Israel (outside of this dyad), which led to events that contributed to this MID. 

COUPMID: MID200 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID200 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID607 

TERRMID: MID607 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID607 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID607 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID involving Turkey, allied with the US, Jordan, and Iraq, in a territorial dispute against Syria, allied with Egypt and the USSR. After border troop buildups by Turkey and Syria, clashes occurred along the disputed border. The Egyptians and the Americans were involved heavily in the MID, in the form of arms support and, in the case of Egypt, supplying troops to fight. Russia is involved in this MID due to its support for Syria. Coded not territory here because the US and Russia did not dispute territory. See TERRLINK.

TERRLINK: MID607 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID607 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID607 from cm narrative, the US and Russia were pulled into this MID due to their support for the primary disputants, Turkey and Syria. Turkey and Syria were disputing their border, and the tensions over the disputed border escalated into clashes along the disputed border. Coded link to territory because the territorial MID between Turkey and Syria caused a MID between US and Russia here. 

MARITMID: MID607 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID607 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID607 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID607 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID607 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID607 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID607 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID607 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID607 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID607 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID607 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID607 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID125 

TERRMID: MID125 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID125 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID125 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID125 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID125 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID125 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID involving the US and UK against USSR, Iraq, and Egypt. In 1958, a faction of military officers overthrew the Iraqi monarchy in a coup, and this stoked revolutionary sentiment in Lebanon, where a civil war was already ongoing. The US and UK landed troops in Lebanon at Lebanon's request to keep the regime in place. USSR, Iraq, and Egypt provided assistance to the revolutionaries in Lebanon, triggering this MID. Coded not civil war MID because the civil war in Lebanon is outside of this dyad. See CIVWARLINK.

CIVWARLINK: MID125 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID125 coded civil war link because the Lebanese civil war triggered a multilateral MID, including this MID between US and Russia, and since the Lebanese civil war is outside of this dyad, it is a civil war link MID. 

COUPMID: MID125 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID125 1 -- coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: MID125 the coup in Iraq contributed to the civil war in Lebanon, and the new Iraqi regime supported the revolutionaries in Lebanon, contributing to this MID. Iraq is outside this dyad.



MID2215 

TERRMID: MID2215 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2215 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2215 from cm narrative, Russian forces shot down a US transport plane. No further escalation resulted. Coded not territorial MID because the action was not advancing a territorial claim between US and Russia. The plane was shot down over Armenia, which was not the subject of a territorial dispute, in 1958.

MID173 

TERRMID: MID173 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID173 from cm narrative, this is another clash between China and Taiwan in which the US provides assistance to Taiwan while Russia helps China. China shelled islands in Taiwan, prompting the US to deploy troops and warships to the region. High-level talks defused the clashes. Coded not territorial because the US and Russia were not disputing territory here. See TERRLINK. 

TERRLINK: MID173 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID173 coded third party link to territory because the China-Taiwan territorial dispute led to these clashes, which pulled their respective allies, Russia and the US, into the MID. US and Russia were both third parties in this territorial MID between China and Taiwan.

MARITMID: MID173 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID173 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID173 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID173 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID173 coded civil war link because the China-Taiwan dispute has a civil war element. 

COUPMID: MID173 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID173 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID608 

TERRMID: MID608 1 -- territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID608 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID involving the US, UK, and France against USSR. Soviet Premier Khrushchev issued an ultimatum for the Western powers to vacate Berlin and withdraw all military resources from there, making West Berlin a sovereign city. Khrushchev also said Russia would turn all lines of communication with West Berlin to East Germany, so the West would only have access to West Berlin through East Germany's permission. The Western powers responded by firmly asserting their determination to remain in West Berlin. Coded somewhat related to territory because the US and USSR were disputing whether the US and others had the right to occupy West Berlin, which was then part of the post-WWII "Western Zone." The Western powers occupied and controlled the Western zone, but had the intention of creating a sovereign state, which they eventually did, the Federal Republic of Germany (West Germany). The US and other powers were therefore not claiming that territory as their own, but they were claiming the right to occupy and control it as they attempted to set up a state. Coded somewhat connected to territory because this was a dispute about who controlled that territory, but the US, UK, and France did not assert that the territory was theirs long-term. This can be thought of as a temporary territorial claim by the US, UK, and France. 

TERRLINK: MID608 1 -- third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID608 coded somewhat connected to third party link to territory to be consistent with TERRMID coding. The USSR also had a TERRMID==2 MID with UK and France in this MID. 

MARITMID: MID608 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID608 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID608 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID608 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID608 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID608 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID246 

TERRMID: MID246 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID246 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID246 from cm narrative, MID246 is the Bay of Pigs invasion. The US sent US-trained Cuban exiles into Cuba in an attempt to overthrow the government. The Cuban government easily defeated them, and the attempted invasion caused increased hostilities between the US and Cuba and Russia. Coded not territory because the attempted invasion was intended to change political leadership in Cuba, and was not a claim on Cuban territory. There was no disputed territory here between the US and Russia. 

TERRLINK: MID246 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID246 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID246 The US-Cuba dispute triggered a MID between the US and Russia here as well, but this was not a territorial MID and thus not a link to territory between US and Russia. 

MARITMID: MID246 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID246 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID246 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID246 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID246 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID246 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID246 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID246 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID246 coded not civil war link because this was a military invasion by US-trained soldiers who had become US citizens. (The US had a policy of granting citizenship to Cuban exiles and refugees.) This was not a militarized rebel group fighting from within Cuba against the government. 

COUPMID: MID246 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID246 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID246 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID246 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID253 

TERRMID: MID253 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID253 from cm narrative, Soviet forces shot down a US reconnaissance plane in Soviet airspace, capturing and imprisoning its pilot. Occurred May-July 1960. Coded not territorial because this was not connected to a territorial dispute.

TERRLINK: MID253 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID253 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID253 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID253 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID253 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID253 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID253 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID253 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID1363 

TERRMID: MID1363 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1363 from cm narrative, this MID is about the internationalized Laotian Civil War. The US and Thailand were supporting the Royal Laotian Government (incumbent), and the USSR, China, and North Vietnam were supporting the communist guerrillas (militarized rebel group). The US and USSR did not want that conflict to lead to a direct conflict between US and USSR, and there was a push to resolve the conflict via a Geneva Conference. China warned that it would intervene with direct military force if SEATO intervened. This threat constitutes MID1363. Coded not territorial because neither the US nor USSR were advancing a territorial claim here.

TERRLINK: MID1363 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1363 this is an internationalized civil war in which several countries supported the rebels or the regimes, but none of these countries were making a claim on Laotian territory. 

MARITMID: MID1363 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1363 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1363 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1363 coded not civil war because the civil war in Laos is outside of this dyad. See CIVWARLINK. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1363 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1363 from cm narrative, this MID was an internationalized Laotian Civil War. The US and USSR supported opposite sides in the war. A threat by China, who was supporting the communist guerrillas as the USSR was, triggered this multilateral MID. Coded civil war link because the Laotian Civil War is outside of this dyad and caused a MID between US and USSR. 

COUPMID: MID1363 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1363 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID27 

TERRMID: MID27 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID27 coded not territory because the territorial dispute involved here is between East and West Germany, outside of this dyad. See TERRLINK.

TERRLINK: MID27 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID27 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID involving Czechoslovakia, Poland, East Germany, and the USSR versus the USA, the UK, France, and West Germany. See TERRMID-NOTES for an explanation of the territorial dispute. Coded third party link to territory because there are several dyads with territorial MIDs in this dispute. The US and Russia were third parties to the East Germany-West Germany territorial dispute. 

MARITMID: MID27 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID27 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID27 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID27 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID27 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID27 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2217 

TERRMID: MID2217 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2217 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2217 from cm narrative, is a bilateral mid that occurred July 25-September 7. The mid is called `Operation Mongoose.' This was a covert U.S. effort to overthrow Fidel Castro after the failure of the Bay of Pigs invasion. It continued throughout the Kennedy administration, but was not an overt use of force. Coded not territorial because the US was not making a territorial claim on Cuba. this was a political leadership issue that triggered a MID between the US and USSR. 

TERRLINK: MID2217 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2217 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2217 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2217 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2217 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2217 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2217 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2217 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2217 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2217 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2217 this MID resulted from US efforts to subvert the Cuban government in a variety of ways, including providing military and economic assistance to anti-government (anti-communist) insurgent groups in Cuba. Coded civil war link because this involved militarized rebel groups opposing the government in Cuba, outside of this dyad and this led to a MID between US and USSR. 

COUPMID: MID2217 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2217 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2217 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2217 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2219 

TERRMID: MID2219 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2219 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2219 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2219 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2219 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID with the US and West Germany v. the USSR and East Germany that occurred from December of 1961 until October of 1962. This mid covers a period of several minor incidents that all served to increase hostilities. In December, the East Germans and the Soviets protested to the United States regarding hostile troop movements along the autobahn link connecting Berlin with West Germany. This was followed by the East German shooting of an American military vehicle that was part of the US mission in Potsdam. East Germany and West Germany had a territorial dispute, as West Germany claimed that East Germany's territory rightly belonged to the West as a united Germany. However, this MID is coded third party link to territorial MID because East and West Germany had a territorial dispute, and the US and USSR backed opposing sides in the territorial claim, leading to this MID between them.

MARITMID: MID2219 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2219 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2219 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2219 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2219 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2219 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2219 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2219 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2219 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2219 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2219 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2219 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID3361 

TERRMID: MID3361 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3361 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID in which China and the USSR threatened that the US was provoking war by building up its forces in South Vietnam. China and USSR were supporting North Vietnam. Coded not territory because the US and USSR were not disputing territory here. See TERRLINK.

TERRLINK: MID3361 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID3361 from cm narrative, the US' support of South Vietnam, and China and USSR's support of North Vietnam triggered this MID. The Vietnam War is a territorial MID because each was trying to control the entire territory of Vietnam. Coded third party link to territory because Vietnam War is a territorial MID and the US and USSR's opposing support triggered this MID.

MARITMID: MID3361 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3361 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3361 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3361 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID3361 the Vietnam War is also considered a civil war MID because North Vietnamese communist guerrillas were present in the South, fighting against the government as part of the war effort, and China and USSR were supporting these guerillas. Coded civil war link because this MID has a civil war element between North and South Vietnam, and US and USSR's opposing support triggered this MID. 

COUPMID: MID3361 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3361 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID1353 

TERRMID: MID1353 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1353 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1353 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1353 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1353 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1353 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1353 from cm narrative, this is related to the Laotian Civil War that takes place from 1963 to 1973. China directly supported the Pathet Lao communist insurgency and conducted military operations in northern Laos, and the USSR provided less direct support to communist insurgents. The US supported the Royal Laotian Government (RLG) forces. Chinese forces directly engaged in combat with RLG forces, triggering this MID due to the US support for RLG forces and USSR's support for communist forces. Coded civil war link because the civil war in Laos is outside of this dyad and led to this MID. 

COUPMID: MID1353 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1353 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2899 

TERRMID: MID2899 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2899 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2899 occurred on March 15, 1963. It is a bilateral one day mid. On this date, Soviet aircraft violated U.S. airspace over Alaska eliciting an American diplomatic protest but no military action. Coded not territory because the US and USSR were not disputing Alaska, and this is a general Cold War tensions MID. 

TERRLINK: MID2899 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2899 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2899 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2899 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2899 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2899 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2899 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2899 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2899 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2899 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2899 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2899 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2899 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2899 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2218 

TERRMID: MID2218 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2218 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2218 1 -- third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2218 3 -- uncertain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2218 from cm narrative, this is related to the security of Berlin and occurred on 4/2/1963. Coded uncertain because no additional historical information could be found on this specific dispute. Coded third party link to territory because West Germany, supported by US, and East Germany, supported by USSR, had a territorial dispute (West Germany claimed East Germany's territory as its own), and previous disputes involving Berlin were third party link to territorial MIDs. 

MARITMID: MID2218 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2218 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2218 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2218 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2218 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2218 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2218 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2218 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2218 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2218 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2218 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2218 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2220 

TERRMID: MID2220 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2220 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2220 from cm narrative, is a border violation involving the Soviet Union, that occurred from January 28-March 27 of 1964. On January 28, an American training plane was shot down over East Germany. On March 10, an American reconnaissance aircraft was shot down under similar circumstances. The crew was returned on March 27. Coded not territory because the US and USSR were not disputing territory between them here. See TERRLINK.

TERRLINK: MID2220 1 -- third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2220 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2220 from cm narrative, this MID was triggered by the US support for West Germany and USSR support for East Germany. West and East Germany had an ongoing territorial dispute. Coded third party link to territory because the territorial dispute between East and West Germany contributed to this MID between the US and USSR when the USSR shot down a US airplane in East German airspace. 

MARITMID: MID2220 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2220 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2220 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2220 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2220 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2220 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2220 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2220 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2220 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2220 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2220 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2220 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2909 

TERRMID: MID2909 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2909 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2909 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2909 3 -- uncertain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2909 from Gibler, Little, and Miller (2016: IIb-31), this MID is a duplicate of MID2220 in which Soviet fighters shot down a US training plane over East Germany. The authors recommend this case be dropped, so this is coded uncertain. 

MARITMID: MID2909 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2909 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2909 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2909 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2909 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2909 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID2909 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2909 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2909 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2909 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2909 3 -- not coup link 
COUPLINK-CER: MID2909 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID611 

TERRMID: MID611 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID611 from cm narrative, this is the Vietnam War. The US was supporting South Vietnam, and China and USSR were supporting North Vietnam and communist guerrillas in South Vietnam. Coded not territorial because the US and USSR were not disputing territory between them, but were supporting opposite sides in a territorial dispute. See TERRLINK. 

TERRLINK: MID611 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID611 from cm narrative, this MID is triggered by the opposing support in the Vietnam War, with the US supporting South Vietnam, and China and USSR supporting North Vietnam and communist insurgents who were fighting in the South. Coded third party link to territory because North Vietnam and South Vietnam were in a territorial dispute, and the Us and USSR's opposing support triggered this MID between them. 

MARITMID: MID611 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID611 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID611 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID611 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID611 the Vietnam War is also considered a civil war MID because it involved communist insurgents in South Vietnam fighting against the government and against US forces. Coded civil war link because the civil war is outside of this dyad and contributed to this MID between US and USSR. 

COUPMID: MID611 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID611 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2901 

TERRMID: MID2901 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2901 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2901 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2901 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2901 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2901 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2901 from NYT 7/18/1964, Soviet vessels fired shots across the bow of a US grain ship. Coded not maritime because this was not connected to any maritime boundary dispute. The proximate cause was a disagreement over unloading fees in a Soviet port, but this may have been more generally caused by Cold War tensions. 

ISLMID: MID2901 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2901 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2901 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2901 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2901 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2901 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2901 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2901 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2901 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2901 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2910 

TERRMID: MID2910 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2910 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2910 from cm narrative, this MID was triggered by a display of force between US and USSR when both sides did a "show of planes," or a display of air power. Coded not territorial because the US and USSR were not disputing territory here and this MID occurred due to general Cold War tensions. 

TERRLINK: MID2910 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2910 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2910 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2910 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2910 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2910 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2910 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2910 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2910 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2910 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2910 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2910 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2910 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2910 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2921 

TERRMID: MID2921 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2921 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2921 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2921 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2921 from NYT 7/16/1966 (from Gibler, Little, and Miller 2016: F-179), the US protested when the Soviets forced down a US helicopter over West German territory. The incident happened along the West Germany-East Germany border as both the US and USSR were patrolling the border. Coded third party link to territory because Eats and West Germany had a territorial dispute, as each claimed the entirety of the other's territory, and the US and USSR MID here was directly connected to that territorial dispute because they were enforcing the territory of their respective sides in the dispute. 

MARITMID: MID2921 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2921 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2921 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2921 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2921 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2921 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2921 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2921 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2921 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2921 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2921 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2921 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2934 

TERRMID: MID2934 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2934 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2934 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2934 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2934 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2934 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2934 from cm narrative, occurred from March 2-22, 1967. A Soviet fishing vessel was fined for fishing in U.S. waters near Alaska. Coded not maritime because the US and USSR did not dispute a maritime boundary and this did not involve advancing any claim. 

ISLMID: MID2934 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2934 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2934 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2934 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2934 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2934 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2934 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2934 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2934 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2934 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2931 

TERRMID: MID2931 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2931 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2931 from cm narrative, occurred on April 28, 1967. The Soviets claimed two U.S. planes buzzed their aircraft off the Greek coast. Coded not territorial because this was a general display of power due to Cold War tensions, and was not connected to any territorial claim between the two countries. 

TERRLINK: MID2931 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2931 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2931 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2931 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2931 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2931 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2931 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2931 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2931 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2931 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2931 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2931 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2931 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2931 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2930 

TERRMID: MID2930 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2930 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2930 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2930 from cm narrative, occurred in May of 1967. The US was conducting naval exercises with Japan and South Korea within a few hundred miles of Soviet territory. USSR ships and warplanes responded by conducting simultaneous exercises, and Soviet ships got so close to Us warships that collisions occurred. Coded not maritime because although this was a naval flare-up, the US and USSR were not disputing maritime territory and this was connected only to military exercises and Cold War tensions. 

ISLMID: MID2930 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2930 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2930 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2930 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2930 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2930 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID345 

TERRMID: MID345 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID345 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID345 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID345 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID345 from cm narrative, this MID preceded the Arab-Israeli War in 1967 and is connected to the tensions that escalated to that war. The US and USSR exchanged displays of naval power (the US was supporting Israel and USSR was supporting Syria), and US deployed warships close to Syrian coast to deter USSR from intervening. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this activity was connected to the Israel vs. Egypt/Syria/Jordan territorial dispute in 1967, which wound up with Israel occupying Sinai, Gaza, West Bank, East Jerusalem, and the Golan Heights. (Note that the parties were not disputing the entirety of the territory. The Golan Heights, Gaza, Sinai Peninsula, and Straits of Tiran were in dispute here.)

MARITMID: MID345 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID345 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID345 is the US and USSR interactions related to the Arab Israeli War in 1967. This multilateral MID is a show of ships involving the Soviet Union and Israel, June 10-19. President Johnson ordered the 6th Fleet to move within 50 miles of the Syrian coast in order to signal the Soviets not to intervene in the war. Coded not maritime because the US and USSR were not disputing a maritime border here, and this was connected to opposing support of Israel (US) and Syria (USSR). See TERRLINK. Part of this dispute involved the Straits of Tiran, so this is a maritime MID between Israel and Egypt, and the US and USSR are linked to this maritime MID.

ISLMID: MID345 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID345 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID345 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID345 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID345 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID345 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID345 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID345 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID345 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID345 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2928 

TERRMID: MID2928 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2928 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2928 is a bilateral mid that occurred from June 30-July 2 1968. A U.S. airliner chartered by Military Airlift Command bound for Cambodia was intercepted by Soviet aircraft off the Kurile islands. No shots were fired. Coded not territory because the US and USSR were not disputing a boundary. See CIVWARLINK.

TERRLINK: MID2928 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2928 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2928 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2928 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2928 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2928 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2928 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2928 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2928 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2928 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2928 from cm narrative, this MID was triggered by USSR intercepting a US airliner on its way to Cambodia. This was during the US efforts in the Vietnam War, which also involved US intervention in the ongoing Cambodian Civil War. MIDs connected to the Cambodian Civil War are civil war MIDs.

COUPMID: MID2928 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2928 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2928 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2928 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2941 

TERRMID: MID2941 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2941 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2941 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2941 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2941 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2941 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2941 from cm narrative, North Korea shot down a US military airplane in April 1969. The US deployed warships to the Sea of Japan, prompting USSR protest and triggering this MID between US and USSR. The US withdrew warships on April 26, 1969. Coded not maritime because the US was not making a maritime claim against USSR, but was responding to an attack by North Korea. 

ISLMID: MID2941 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2941 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2941 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2941 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2941 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2941 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2941 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2941 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2941 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2941 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID3241 

TERRMID: MID3241 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3241 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3241 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3241 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3241 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3241 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3241 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3241 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3241 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3241 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3241 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3241 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID3241 is associated with events surrounding the Jordanian Civil War of 1970. This multilateral MID involved Jordan, Syria, Libya, Iraq, the US, the USSR and the UK. The U.S. ordered three aircraft carriers to the Middle East and alerted ground forces in order to warn the Syrians against intervening in the ongoing Jordanian civil strife. The USSR was providing support to Syria during this time, triggering this MID between US and USSR. Coded civil war link because the civil war in Jordan led to the US and USSR being involved in this MID due to opposing support. 

COUPMID: MID3241 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3241 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3241 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3241 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2221 

TERRMID: MID2221 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2221 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2221 from cm narrative, a US plane flying near Soviet airspace was forced down and 2 generals were detained October 10, 1970. They were released about one month later. Coded not territorial because this is a MID connected to general Cold War tensions; the US and USSR were not disputing territory here. 

TERRLINK: MID2221 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2221 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MID2949 

TERRMID: MID2949 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2949 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2949 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2949 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2949 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2949 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2949 occurred in 1972. This was a seizure involving the United States and the Soviet Union. The US Coast Guard seized a Soviet fishing vessel and arrested its captain for fishing illegally and attempting to flee. Coded not maritime because there was no maritime dispute here between US and USSR. 

ISLMID: MID2949 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2949 1 -- certain

MID353 

TERRMID: MID353 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID353 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID353 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID353 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID353 from cm narrative, this MID is concurrent with the Yom Kippur War in October 1973. The US supported Israel, while USSR supported Egypt and Syria. The US and USSR's opposing support during this territorial MID (specifically over Sinai and Golan Heights) between Israel and Egypt & Syria pulls them into this MID. Coded third party link to territory because the Us and USSR are third parties to the territorial dispute. 

MARITMID: MID353 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID353 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID353 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID353 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID-CER: MID353 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID353 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID353 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID353 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2222 

TERRMID: MID2222 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2222 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2222 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2222 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2222 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2222 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2222 from cm narrative, this is a seizure involving the Soviet Union, April 9-10 1977. Two Soviet fishing boats were seized off the New England coast for violating the 200-mile territorial waters limit. Coded not maritime because the US and USSR were not disputing the maritime boundary, and this seems to be a product of general Cold War tensions. 

ISLMID: MID2222 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2222 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2222 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2222 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2224 

TERRMID: MID2224 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2224 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2224 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2224 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2224 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2224 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2224 from cm narrative, this is the seizure of a US torpedo boat by the USSR in August 1979, resulting in a "show of ships," or a mutual display of naval power. Coded not maritime because the US and USSR were not disputing a maritime boundary, and this appears to be a product of general Cold War tensions. 

ISLMID: MID2224 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2224 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2224 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2224 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2224 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID2224 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2224 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2224 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2225 

TERRMID: MID2225 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2225 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2225 from cm narrative, this was a show of troops in Cuba, occurring August 31 - November 20 1980. Soviet troops in Cuba engaged in military exercises as a display of force toward the US. Coded not territory because neither the USSR nor Cuba was making a claim on US territory here; this appears to be a product of general Cold War tensions. 

TERRLINK: MID2225 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2225 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2225 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2225 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID-CER: MID2225 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2225 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-NOTES:

COUPLINK-CER: MID2225 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2226 

TERRMID: MID2226 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2226 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2226 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2226 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2226 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2226 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2226 from cm narrative, this involves a show of ships, or a mutual display of naval power, between USSR and several NATO countries, including the US. Coded not maritime because the Us and USSR were not disputing a maritime boundary here, and this seems to be a product of general Cold War tensions. 

ISLMID: MID2226 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2226 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2226 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2226 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2226 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2226 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2226 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2226 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2226 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2226 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2227 

TERRMID: MID2227 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2227 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2227 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2227 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2227 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2227 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2227 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2227 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2227 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2227 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2227 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2227 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2227 from cm narrative, this is considered a threat of force involving the Soviet Union on May 4. President Carter affirmed U.S. support for Yugoslavian independence on May 4, 1980, during a visit to the country. Carter had stated at a news conference on February 13 that the United States would assist Yugoslavia in resisting Soviet intimidation, triggering this MID. Coded civil war link because the events of Yugoslav Wars (outside of this dyad), including the US attempting to deter the USSR from intervening here, are connected to this MID. The Yugoslav Wars are considered civil war MID(s) because they involve ethnically-based separatist conflicts and insurgencies. 

COUPMID: MID2227 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2227 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2227 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2227 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2228 

TERRMID: MID2228 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2228 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2228 from cm narrative, this is a seizure initiated by the United States involving the Soviet Union, May 12-14. U.S. Customs inspectors held Soviet air cargo at Dulles airport until it was discovered that only minor paperwork violations could be found. The Soviets protested, but took no other action. Coded not territorial because there was no territorial dispute here (occurred on US mainland territory), and this seems to be a product of general Cold War tensions. 

TERRLINK: MID2228 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2228 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2228 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2228 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2228 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2228 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2228 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2228 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2228 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2228 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2228 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2228 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2228 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2228 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2229 

TERRMID: MID2229 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2229 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2229 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2229 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2229 this is a multilateral MID involving US and Japan vs. USSR. Japan and USSR disputed sovereignty over the Kuril Islands following WWII (Elleman, Nichols, and Ouimet 1998). From cm narrative, this MID is known as the "Militarization of Kuril Islands." This MID involves a show of planes between US and USSR and a public US commitment to deploy 50 planes to Honshu, a Japanese island, by 1985. USSR protested but took no action. Coded not islands because islands were not disputed between US and USSR, and this did not seem to come from the islands dispute itself, but rather from general Cold War tensions. The name of the MID seems misleading as well, since Honshu, where the US committed to deploying planes, is not part of the disputed Kuril Islands. 

CIVWARMID: MID2229 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2229 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2229 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2229 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2229 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2982 

TERRMID: MID2982 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2982 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2982 from cm narrative, this MID occurred on December 16, 1982. This is a bilateral dispute. On this date, the Soviets briefly detained two American journalists who had contacted Jewish dissidents, but the American embassy had no comment when asked about the incident. Coded not territorial because it was not connected to any territorial dispute between these countries. 

TERRLINK: MID2982 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2982 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2982 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2982 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2982 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2982 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2982 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2982 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2982 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2982 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2982 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2982 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2982 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2982 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2231 

TERRMID: MID2231 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2231 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2231 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2231 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2231 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID involving shows of force between the US with West Germany and USSR with Czechoslovakia. The US installed missiles in West Germany, and USSR did the same in Czechoslovakia. Threatening behavior using warplanes ensued. Coded not third party link to territory because although West Germany, a US ally, had a territorial dispute against East Germany, a USSR ally, this MID is not connected to that territorial dispute. East Germany is not involved in this MID and the threats here escalated from missile installations, which were themselves a part of routine Cold War behavior between US and USSR. 

MARITMID: MID2231 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2231 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2231 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2231 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2231 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2231 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2231 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2231 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2231 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2231 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2231 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2231 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2230 

TERRMID: MID2230 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2230 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2230 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2230 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2230 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2230 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2230 is a bilateral dispute with the USSR that occurred September 12-19. The Soviets seized a U.S. commercial vessel that accidentally ventured into Soviet waters near Alaska. The ship was released after American protests. Coded not maritime because the maritime boundary was not disputed. This was likely the result of general Cold War tensions. There was no maritime boundary dispute between the US/USSR.

ISLMID: MID2230 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2230 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2230 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2230 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2230 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2230 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2230 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2230 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2230 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2230 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2232 

TERRMID: MID2232 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2232 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2232 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2232 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2232 from cm narrative, this MID occurred when a US military officer was shot in East Germany by the Soviets. The US and USSR had agreed since 1947 that each side was permitted to observe the other's activities in East/West Germany (US could observe Soviet activities in the East, and vice versa). The US officer was shot while on one of these observations, prompting protest from the US but no retaliation. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this incident occurred in territory that was disputed by East and West Germany. The US and USSR presence in the area was tied to them backing opposing sides in the territorial dispute, and the tensions that led to this MID were partially because of the East/West dispute.

MARITMID: MID2232 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2232 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2232 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2232 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2232 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2232 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2232 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2232 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2232 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2232 1 -- certain

COUPLINK: MID2232 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2232 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID3637 

TERRMID: MID3637 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3637 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3637 from NYT 1/15/1986, two Libyan fighter planes buzzed a US recon plane. The Libyan planes were being directed by a Soviet surveillance aircraft, pulling the USSR into this MID. Coded not territory because this is connected to general Cold War tensions, and no territorial boundary was being disputed here.

MID4220 

TERRMID: MID4220 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4220 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4220 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4220 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4220 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4220 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4220 from cm narrative, on two separate occasions (10/17/2000 and 10/19/2000), two Russian jets fly over the USS Kitty Hawk on its way to, and then from, exercises in the Korean Straits. Both times the Russian jets were chased by American F-18s, triggering this MID. Coded not maritime because they were not disputing their maritime boundary and this was about US naval exercises near Russian territory. These naval exercises were not connected to advancing any claims of any type.

MID4197

TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4197 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4197 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4197 from cm narrative, Russia deployed 7 nuclear-capable bombers to its bases in the Arctic, prompting the US and Canada to deploy planes to the area, triggering this MID. Coded not maritime because the maritime boundary was not contested. 

ISLMID: MID4197 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4197 1 -- certain

COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID4241 

TERRMID: MID4241 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4241 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4241 from cm narrative, MID4241 is a Russian display of force against the US in September of 2001. The US took no military action. No further information on this dispute could be found in NYT archives, Keesings, Facts on File, or a Lexis Nexis search, although it appears that the Russian parliament was debating offering some type of assistance to the US in attacking Afghanistan. At one point, Putin even offered to allow the US to use an air base in Tajikistan, a former USSR satellite, from which to bomb Afghanistan (Daily Star 9/15/2001). It therefore seems that the US and Russia were not particularly quarrelsome around the time of this MID and the Russian display of force which triggered this MID may be an isolated incident and not indicative of general US-Russian relations at the time. Coded uncertain because of lack of information on this particular MID. 

TERRLINK: MID4241 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4241 3 -- uncertain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4241 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4241 3 -- uncertain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4241 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4241 3 -- uncertain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4241 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4241 3 -- uncertain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4241 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4241 3 -- uncertain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID4241 3 -- uncertain
